"""
 This script define all rates to apply in 2006 to calculate an entire paysheet
 according french fiscal & social rules for a SME.
 """
 
 kw = {}
 
 
 ##########################
 # This part of the script define usefull variables to help us calculate dynamic rates and contributions.
 # This part depend mostly of the current localisation.
 ##########################
 
 paysheet = context.getObject()
 paysheet_type = paysheet.getPortalType()
 
 employee = paysheet.getDestinationSectionValue()
 company = paysheet.getSourceSectionValue()
 
 # Get Paysheet datas
 gross_salary = abs(paysheet.getGrossSalary())
 start_date = paysheet.getStartDate()
 stop_date = paysheet.getStopDate()
 
 # Each year, look at http://www.urssaf.fr to complete the table
 ceiling_salary_list = { 2003: 2432.0
 , 2004: 2476.0
 , 2005: 2516.0
 , 2006: 2589.0
 }
 # The default ceiling salary is the last one
 paysheet_year = start_date.year()
 ceiling_salary_available_years = ceiling_salary_list.keys()
 if paysheet_year not in ceiling_salary_available_years:
 paysheet_year = ceiling_salary_available_years[-1]
 ceiling_salary = ceiling_salary_list[paysheet_year]
 
 # Limited salary = salaire plafonnee
 if gross_salary < ceiling_salary:
 limited_salary = gross_salary
 else:
 limited_salary = ceiling_salary
 
 # Check if the employee is executive or not
 if employee.getCareerGrade().endswith('engineer'):
 executive = True
 else:
 executive = False
 
 # Get company related data
 company_birth = company.getCreationDate()
 employee_list = company.Organisation_getEmployeeList( start_date = start_date
 , stop_date = stop_date
 )
 company_size = len(employee_list)
 
 # Get the list of all slice the employee fall in
 salary_slices = {}
 
 # "Char" slice type
 # TODO: Slices should be calculated based on the total gross salary over the year divided by 12 month.
 # This is why there is a problem for people who have changing gross salary over the year.
 # That's why accountants must do manual regulations in those cases.
 slice_a_value = ceiling_salary
 slice_b_value = ceiling_salary * 4
 slice_c_value = ceiling_salary * 8
 if gross_salary < slice_a_value:
 salary_slices['A'] = gross_salary
 else:
 salary_slices['A'] = slice_a_value
 if gross_salary < slice_b_value:
 salary_slices['B'] = float(gross_salary) - float(slice_a_value)
 else:
 salary_slices['B'] = slice_b_value
 if gross_salary < slice_c_value:
 salary_slices['C'] = float(gross_salary) - float(slice_b_value)
 else:
 salary_slices['C'] = slice_c_value
 
 # "Number" slice type
 slice_1_value = ceiling_salary
 slice_2_value = ceiling_salary * 3
 if gross_salary < slice_1_value:
 salary_slices['1'] = gross_salary
 else:
 salary_slices['1'] = slice_1_value
 if gross_salary < slice_2_value:
 salary_slices['2'] = gross_salary - slice_1_value
 else:
 salary_slices['2'] = slice_2_value
 
 # Age-slice of the company
 old_limit = DateTime(1997, 1, 1)
 if company_birth < old_limit:
 comp_type = 'old'
 else:
 comp_type = 'new'
 
 
 
 ##########################
 # This part of the script calculate the default salaey range and rates.
 # This part is the core of the script: all rates and amounts are defined below.
 #
 # Here is a model of a line definition:
 # kw['payroll_service_id/salary_range_category_id'] = \
 # { 'employer_share': employer_rate_in_percent
 # , 'employee_share': employee_rate_in_percent
 # , 'base' : contribution_base_in_currency
 # }
 # Rates and base must be floats.
 # Be carefull: Rates are not in percents !
 ##########################
 
 # Sickness insurance = Assurance maladie
 if executive:
 employer_rate = None
 employee_rate = 0.85
 else:
 employer_rate = 13.10
 employee_rate = 0.75
 kw['sickness_insurance/salaire_brut'] = \
 { 'employer_share': employer_rate
 , 'employee_share': employee_rate
 , 'base' : gross_salary
 }
 
 # Old-age insurance = Assurance vieillesse
 if executive:
 kw['oldage_insurance/salaire_plafonne'] = \
 { 'employer_share': None
 , 'employee_share': 6.65
 , 'base' : limited_salary
 }
 else:
 kw['oldage_insurance/salaire_brut'] = \
 { 'employer_share': 1.60
 , 'employee_share': 0.10
 , 'base' : gross_salary
 }
 kw['oldage_insurance/salaire_plafonne'] = \
 { 'employer_share': 8.30
 , 'employee_share': 6.65
 , 'base' : limited_salary
 }
 
 # Family benefits = Allocations familliale
 if not executive:
 kw['family_benefits/salaire_brut'] = \
 { 'employer_share': 5.40
 , 'employee_share': None
 , 'base' : gross_salary
 }
 
 # Industrial accident = Accidents du travail
 if not executive:
 kw['industrial_accident/salaire_brut'] = \
 { 'employer_share': 1.10
 , 'employee_share': None
 , 'base' : gross_salary
 }
 
 # Lodging helps = Aide au logemenent
 # if company_size > 9:
 # kw['lodging_helps/salaire_brut'] = \
 # { 'employer_share': 0.40
 # , 'employee_share': None
 # , 'base' : gross_salary
 # }
 # else:
 kw['lodging_helps/salaire_plafonne'] = \
 { 'employer_share': 0.10
 , 'employee_share': None
 , 'base' : limited_salary
 }
 
 # Solidarity day = Journ\xe9e de Solidarit\xe9
 kw['solidarity_day/salaire_brut'] = \
 { 'employer_share': 0.30
 , 'employee_share': None
 , 'base' : gross_salary
 }
 
 # Transport payment
 # TODO: rate depending of the town, 1.80 is the 'default' value (when the town isn't referenced by laws)
 # TODO: Even if the company size is more than 9, you don't pay this contribution until 3 years.
 # The 4th year you pay 25%
 # The 5th year you pay 50%
 # The 6th year you pay 75%
 # Starting from the 7th year you pay 100%
 # if company_size > 9:
 # kw['transport_payment/salaire_brut'] = \
 # { 'employer_share': 1.80
 # , 'employee_share': None
 # , 'base' : gross_salary
 # }
 
 # CSG
 kw['csg_deductible/salaire_brut_csg'] = \
 { 'employer_share': None
 , 'employee_share': 5.10
 , 'base' : 0.97 * gross_salary
 }
 kw['csg_non_deductible/salaire_brut_csg'] = \
 { 'employer_share': None
 , 'employee_share': 2.9
 , 'base' : 0.97 * gross_salary
 }
 
 # CRDS
 # kw['crds/salaire_brut_crds'] = \
 # { 'employer_share': None
 # , 'employee_share': 0.50
 # , 'base' : 0.97 * gross_salary
 # }
 
 # Unemployment insurance = Assurance chomage
 kw['unemployment_insurance/salaire_brut'] = \
 { 'employer_share': 4.04
 , 'employee_share': 2.44
 , 'base' : gross_salary
 }
 
 # FNGS
 # Employer rate has changed starting from jul, 1st 2006
 fngs_employer_rate = 0.25
 if start_date >= DateTime(2006, 7, 1):
 fngs_employer_rate = 0.15
 kw['fngs/salaire_brut'] = \
 { 'employer_share': fngs_employer_rate
 , 'employee_share': None
 , 'base' : gross_salary
 }
 
 # ARRCO
 if not executive:
 if salary_slices.has_key('1'):
 kw['arrco/tranche_1'] = \
 { 'employer_share': 4.5
 , 'employee_share': 3.0
 , 'base' : salary_slices['1']
 }
 if salary_slices.has_key('2'):
 if comp_type == 'old':
 employee_share_rate = 6.0
 employer_share_rate = 9.0
 else:
 employee_share_rate = 8.0
 employer_share_rate = 12.0
 kw['arrco/tranche_2'] = \
 { 'employer_share': employer_share_rate
 , 'employee_share': employee_share_rate
 , 'base' : salary_slices['2']
 }
 elif salary_slices.has_key('A'):
 kw['arrco/tranche_a'] = \
 { 'employer_share': 4.5
 , 'employee_share': 3.0
 , 'base' : salary_slices['A']
 }
 
 # AGFF
 if executive:
 if salary_slices.has_key('A'):
 kw['agff_tranche_a/tranche_a'] = \
 { 'employer_share': 1.20
 , 'employee_share': 0.80
 , 'base' : salary_slices['A']
 }
 if salary_slices.has_key('B'):
 kw['agff_tranche_b/tranche_b'] = \
 { 'employer_share': 1.30
 , 'employee_share': 0.90
 , 'base' : salary_slices['B']
 }
 else:
 if salary_slices.has_key('1'):
 kw['agff_tranche_a/tranche_1'] = \
 { 'employer_share': 1.20
 , 'employee_share': 0.80
 , 'base' : salary_slices['1']
 }
 if salary_slices.has_key('2'):
 kw['agff_tranche_b/tranche_2'] = \
 { 'employer_share': 1.30
 , 'employee_share': 0.90
 , 'base' : salary_slices['2']
 }
 
 # ARGIC
 # TODO: fix the repartition of share rate in case of slice C
 if executive:
 if salary_slices.has_key('B'):
 kw['argic/tranche_b'] = \
 { 'employer_share': 12.60
 , 'employee_share': 7.70
 , 'base' : salary_slices['B']
 }
 if salary_slices.has_key('C'):
 # free repartition (20.30% to share between employee & employer)
 kw['argic/tranche_c'] = \
 { 'employer_share': 10.15
 , 'employee_share': 10.15
 , 'base' : salary_slices['C']
 }
 
 # CET
 if executive:
 if salary_slices.has_key('A'):
 kw['cet/tranche_a'] = \
 { 'employer_share': 0.22
 , 'employee_share': 0.13
 , 'base' : salary_slices['A']
 }
 if salary_slices.has_key('B'):
 kw['cet/tranche_b'] = \
 { 'employer_share': 0.22
 , 'employee_share': 0.13
 , 'base' : salary_slices['B']
 }
 if salary_slices.has_key('C'):
 kw['cet/tranche_c'] = \
 { 'employer_share': 0.22
 , 'employee_share': 0.13
 , 'base' : salary_slices['C']
 }
 
 # Life insurance = Assurance vie
 # if executive == True and salary_slices.has_key('A'):
 # kw['life_insurance/tranche_a'] = \
 # { 'employer_share': 1.5
 # , 'employee_share': None
 # , 'base' : salary_slices['A']
 # }
 
 # APEC forfaitaire
 # This contribution is due for March only
 comp_date = DateTime(start_date.year(), 3, 31)
 while comp_date < comp_date:
 comp_date = DateTime(comp_date.year() + 1, 3, 31)
 context.log("kev date", repr(comp_date))
 if executive and start_date <= comp_date <= stop_date:
 kw['apec/forfait'] = \
 { 'employer_share': 3.72
 , 'employee_share': 2.49
 , 'base' : 1.0
 }
 if salary_slices.has_key('B'):
 kw['apec/tranche_b'] = \
 { 'employer_share': 0.036
 , 'employee_share': 0.024
 , 'base' : salary_slices['B']
 }
 
 # Retirement = Retraite Cadre forfaitaire
 if executive and not salary_slices.has_key('B') and not salary_slices.has_key('C'):
 kw['cavcic/forfait'] = \
 { 'employer_share': 35.62
 , 'employee_share': 21.21
 , 'base' : 1.0
 }
 
 # construction tax
 # if company_size > 9:
 # kw['construction_tax/salaire_brut'] = \
 # { 'employer_share': 0.45
 # , 'employee_share': None
 # , 'base' : gross_salary
 # }
 
 # training tax
 # kw['training_tax/salaire_brut'] = \
 # { 'employer_share': 0.50
 # , 'employee_share': None
 # , 'base' : gross_salary
 # }
 
 # courses tax
 # if company_size < 10:
 # rate = 0.15
 # else:
 # rate = 1.5
 # kw['courses_tax/salaire_brut'] = \
 # { 'employer_share': rate
 # , 'employee_share': None
 # , 'base' : gross_salary
 # }
 
 # Syntec convention
 # TODO: We can't take the decision based on the CollectiveAgreementTitle since each
 # employee has the right to choose if they want benefit from the insurance or not.
 # We can use instead the social_contract property of the (near-)future HR-related stuff.
 col_agr = employee.getCareerCollectiveAgreementTitle()
 if col_agr not in (None, '') and 'syntec' in col_agr.lower():
 # set the syntec rate according to the employee marital status
 syntec_rate = 0.96
 if employee.getMaritalStatusId() == 'married':
 syntec_rate *= 2
 kw['syntec_insurance/salaire_plafonne_syntec'] = \
 { 'employer_share': syntec_rate
 , 'employee_share': syntec_rate
 , 'base' : ceiling_salary
 }
 
 # Also add a brand new line for "Reduction Fillon", a negative contribution.
 # This tax can be calculated automaticcaly.
 # Because of lack of time we just let the accountant do the work.
 # See coresponding service description for more details.
 kw['reduction_fillon_forfait/forfait'] = \
 { 'employer_share': None
 , 'employee_share': None
 , 'base' : 1.0
 }
 
 # Add blank lines for services which is a variable part od the gross salary.
 # Thanks to this, the accountant has the freedom to add the missing amount of money
 # that this script can't guess.
 kw['retenue_maladie/base'] = \
 { 'employer_share': None
 , 'employee_share': None
 , 'base' : 1.0
 }
 kw['primes/base'] = \
 { 'employer_share': None
 , 'employee_share': None
 , 'base' : 1.0
 }
 kw['absences/base'] = \
 { 'employer_share': None
 , 'employee_share': None
 , 'base' : 1.0
 }
 kw['iccp/base'] = \
 { 'employer_share': None
 , 'employee_share': None
 , 'base' : 1.0
 }
 kw['precarite/base'] = \
 { 'employer_share': None
 , 'employee_share': None
 , 'base' : 1.0
 }
 
 return kw
